Description: Terracotta figure of woman (?). Head fragment broken from plaque. Large almond shaped eyes with well-defined eye lids. Small nose. Hair is parted in the middle, her curls framing her forehead. Clay pressed into a one piece mould. Pierced with a hole for suspension (?). Fine yellow-cream calcaric clay with fine white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Early to mid 4th century BC parallels from Crete in a similar fabric (Higgins 1970, 599-601). Fabric also consistent with a Cypriot origin.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DA.107) (Phase 3)
